intro: Pasania cyclophora, commonly known as the cyclophore corymbia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that appear in dense clusters. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces woody蒴果 that contain several seeds. Pasania cyclophora is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern and western Australia.
